contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Valley Head, Alabama |settlement_type = [[Town]] |image_skyline = |imagesize = |image_caption = |image_seal = |image_map = DeKalb_County_Alabama_Incorporated_and_Unincorporated_areas_Valley_Head_Highlighted.svg |mapsize = 250px |map_caption = Location in [[DeKalb County, Alabama|DeKalb County]] and the state of [[Alabama]] |image_map1 = |mapsize1 = |map_caption1 = |coordinates_region = US-AL |subdivision_type = [[List of countries|Country]] |subdivision_type1 = [[US state|State]] |subdivision_type2 = [[List of counties in Alabama|County]] |subdivision_name = [[United States]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Alabama]] |subdivision_name2 = [[DeKalb County, Alabama|DeKalb]] |government_type = |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_date = |area_magnitude = |area_total_km2 = 9 |area_total_sq_mi = 3.5 |area_land_km2 = 9 |area_land_sq_mi = 3.5 |area_water_km2 = 0 |area_water_sq_mi = 0 |elevation_ft = 1014 |elevation_m = 309 |population_as_of = 2009 |population_footnotes = |population_total = 658 |population_metro = |population_density_km2 = 67.9 |population_density_sq_mi = 174.6 |timezone = [[Central Time Zone (North America)|Central (CST)]] |utc_offset = -6 |latd = 34 |latm = 33 |lats = 55 |latNS = N |longd = 85 |longm = 36 |longs = 59 |longEW = W |timezone_DST = CDT |utc_offset_DST = -5 |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]] |postal_code = 35989 |area_code = [[Area code 256|256]] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 01-78240 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 0155288 |footnotes = |website = }} '''Valley Head''' is a town in [[DeKalb County, Alabama|DeKalb County]], [[Alabama]], [[United States]]. At the 2009 census the population was 658. ==Geography== Valley Head is located at {{coord|34|33|55|N|85|36|59|W|type:city}} (34.565301, -85.616426){{GR|1}}. According to the [[U.S. Census Bureau]], the town has a total area of {{convert|3.5|sqmi|km2}}, all of it land. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 611 people, 244 households, and 175 families residing in the town. The [[population density]] was 175.3 people per square mile (67.6/km²). There were 269 housing units at an average density of 77.2 per square mile (29.8/km²). The racial makeup of the town was 92.47% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 2.29% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 0.65% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 0.16% [[Race (United States Census)|Asian]], 0.16% [[Race (United States Census)|Pacific Islander]], and 4.26% from two or more races. 2.29% of the population were [[Race (United States Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race. There were 244 households out of which 28.7% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 54.5% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 14.8% had a female householder with no husband present, and 27.9% were non-families. 25.0% of all households were made up of individuals and 11.9% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.50 and the average family size was 2.98. In the town the population was spread out with 24.2% under the age of 18, 9.3% from 18 to 24, 24.7% from 25 to 44, 25.2% from 45 to 64, and 16.5% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 38 years. For every 100 females there were 85.2 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 86.7 males. The median income for a household in the town was $29,013, and the median income for a family was $36,250. Males had a median income of $28,558 versus $17,222 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the town was $13,582. About 12.2% of families and 15.9% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 21.4% of those under age 18 and 21.5% of those age 65 or over. ==Education== Valley Head School is home of the [[Tiger]]s, is a member of the [[DeKalb County School System (Alabama)|DeKalb County School System]]. ==Notable native== *[[Howard Finster]], [[folk artist]] == References == {{reflist}} {{Coord|display=title|34.565301|-85.616426}} {{DeKalb County, Alabama}} [[Category:Populated places in DeKalb County, Alabama]] [[Category:Towns in Alabama]]
